Articles.Content:
So KSP was again 'reviewed' - or perhaps 'overviewed' is the better term to use - on Good Game Spawn Point tonight. Junior players (going by the grammar standards and skill level) ask the hosts questions, and they answer in an unfortunately protracted method.

But hey, any publicity is good publicity! After all, it was my son watching GGSP in the afternoon that gave me my first glimpse at a certain game with awesome potential

Here's the online section of the episode for anyone wanting to watch:

http://www.abc.net.au/abc3/goodgamesp/transcripts/s3761480.htm

What the hell did I just watch?

No wonder kids are so stupid these days.

Wow, what the ****************!!!!

Okay, okay, I like the fact that they show basic principles to kids, thou maybe they are unable to understand them with all the stupidity around.
Dear god, no. WHY, WHY DO WRITERS THINK CHILDREN ENJOY THIS!
I was managing until the gravity turn, or in fact the lack of it.

I was managing until the gravity turn, or in fact the lack of it.

Like chicken said... Kind of, it wouldn't be so bad if they were actually TEACHING them about the general principles involved, but they weren't. Quite the opposite.
Wow, this was amazingly bad on SOOOOO many levels...
It is free publicity for KSP though..

Good Game (regular version) is usually pretty good. Spawn Point is for kids but I definitely think they make it a bit too childish a lot of the time with the lame humour and whatnot. And for some games I think this is okay, but a game like KSP that takes a lot of patience and understanding of orbital mechanics I think they're definitely aiming far too young. This segment was a mess.

Errrrr..... WHAT?

DRAG ISN'T CURRENTLY ACTIVE YOU SILLY ROBOT! So you can make stupid unaerodynamic monsters at the moment.

Errrrr..... WHAT?

DRAG ISN'T CURRENTLY ACTIVE YOU SILLY ROBOT! So you can make stupid unaerodynamic monsters at the moment.

Shows how much research they put into the game...

Yeah... Expert... Ex is a has-been and spurt is a drip under pressure.

I blame the lack of oxygen in their spacecraft. Obviously had a touch of brain damage hehe.

It's a shame that they know so little about the best way to play this game. However, in a previous episode they admit since they play so many different games, they are rubbish at most of them. Ksp takes quite a lot of time to play properly which they obviously don't have. Thats likely the reasoning behind the common Noob errors. PS I'm a regular watcher of GG and GGSP.
Brain bleach anyone?
THAT gravity turn...
Wow, that was.... good? No, sorry. Bad. Very, very bad.
Australian taxpayers money well spent...
Reminds me of some of the old sid and marty croft shows on sat mornings. gads but I hated them.
my reaction, "ITS PRONOUNCED MOON YOU F**K!"
What a spectacularly novel form of child abuse!
Wow, this thread's comments still did not prepare me for what I just watched.

Brain bleach anyone?

Ill take 100 of them.

That was so........., words can't express my feelings from that.
I shouldn't have expected much when they talked about an orbit 'at 130 m/s'

Wow.

Wow.

I have no other words.

Wow.
Well, I'm surprised that media aknownledges the existence of PC gaming. And hey, they actually got to Duna, that's something.
